subject: Communication
title: Lost in Translation: Untranslatable Words
description: A 60-second lesson on Lost in Translation: Untranslatable Words.

hook.text: Japanese has 'komorebi' â€” sunlight filtering through leaves. English has no word for it. Does that mean we don't see it?

buildup.text: Every language has words with no direct translation. 'Saudade' (Portuguese), 'Hygge' (Danish), 'Schadenfreude' (German).

discovery.text: Untranslatable words reveal what a culture pays attention to.

twist.text: When you learn a new language, you don't just gain words. You gain new categories of perception and feeling.

climax.text: Cross-cultural communication fails when we assume our language maps perfectly onto another. It never does.

punchline.text: Some feelings only exist in certain languages.

quiz.question: What does the existence of untranslatable words reveal?
options: What a culture pays attention to
